title: 105_hr1722
content:
The "Bank Regulation Adjustment Act" establishes criminal liability for certain activities related to credit cards. Section 134 of the Truth in Lending Act is amended to redesignate paragraphs and provisions, adjusting margins and removing certain wording. Section 134 of the Truth in Lending Act is amended to include new paragraphs regarding fraudulent use of interstate commerce for notifying creditors of billing errors or unauthorized credit card use. The Truth in Lending Act is amended to include new provisions regarding fraudulent use of interstate commerce for credit card applications, including submitting forged or false information to issuers. Credit card issuers who violate the new provisions regarding fraudulent use of interstate commerce for credit card applications may face fines, imprisonment for up to 10 years, or both. SEC. 3. Decrease in burdens associated with currency transaction reporting requirements. Section 5313 of title 31, United States Code, is amended to require an annual inflation adjustment for transaction reporting amounts. Depository institutions with less than 50 reports per month can file on a quarterly basis. The amendment does not affect the obligation of depository institutions to report suspicious transactions promptly under section 5318(g). SEC. 4. REPEAL OF ``DUE ON DEMAND'' REQUIREMENT FOR LOANS TO INSIDERS. Amends Section 22(g) of the Federal Reserve Act by removing certain paragraphs and redesignating others. SEC. 5. REPEAL OF AUTHORITY TO ASSESS EXAMINATION FEES ON STATE DEPOSITORY INSTITUTIONS. SEC. 6. Effective Date of Banking Regulations. Amends the Federal Reserve Act and the Federal Deposit Insurance Act to make changes regarding state member banks and nonmember state depository institutions. SEC. 6. EFFECTIVE DATE OF BANKING REGULATIONS. Regulations by Federal banking agencies must wait 180 days after publication in the Federal Register to take effect, unless specified otherwise by law. Exceptions for regulations reducing burdens on depository institutions. Definitions for "depository institution" and "Federal banking agency" as per the Federal Deposit Insurance Act. SEC. 7. OTHER PROVISIONS. (a) Field of Membership Authority.--Section 109 of the Federal Credit Union Act is amended to limit the membership of any Federal credit union to groups with common bonds.
(b) Expansion of Voting Period Before Conversion to Another Form of Depository Institution.--Regulations under the Federal Credit Union Act must allow credit unions to conduct a vote before transferring deposits to an insured depository institution. The Federal Deposit Insurance Act allows credit unions to provide notice of a vote up to 90 days before the date of the vote. SEC. 8. Exemption for fees and income of depository institutions related to certain assets. Fees and income up to $350,000,000 of total assets of a depository institution are excluded from gross income for federal tax purposes starting after December 31, 1997.
